abstracts.cdata!:
The overall assessment of the project
            has been rated as marginally satisfactory. Project
            sustainability is regarded as likely, World Bank performance
            is rated as satisfactory and borrower performance is rated
            overall as satisfactory. Lessons learned are identified as
            the following: Advance procurement--that, hiring
            consultants, appointment of contractors, etc.) should be
            part of various stages of project preparation and
            processing. The Ceylon Electricity Board's (CEB)
            authority to handle procurement independently of the
            government should be enhanced. Give CEB autonomy so that it
            facilitates effective project implementation--this may
            require incorporating CEB under the Companies Act. Entrust
            project implementation to those dedicated to that task.
            Evaluate the security situation properly, and exclude works
            in areas prone to civil unrest. Set up an independent
            regulatory regime to ensure the sector's financial
            viability. Promote private investments and operations to
            complement public resources. At appraisal, pay attention to
            financial management in general, and submit audited accounts
            on a timely basis in particular.
